title: Mayor's Office of Housing and Community Development Non-Unit Inclusionary Housing Alternatives
description:
A. SUMMARY This dataset shows all projects that satisfied their Inclusionary Housing requirements through one of the options other than on-site affordable units, although some of these projects met requirements through a combination of options that included on-site units. B. HOW THE DATASET IS CREATED Developments of 10 or more units that are subject to Planning Code Section 415 fall under the City's Inclusionary Affordable Housing program. Section 415 requires that developers include affordable units on-site or alternatively pay a fee or dedicate land to MOHCD, or build affordable units at another location (off-site). C. UPDATE PROCESS This dataset will be updated on an as needed basis. D. RELATED DATASETS
  • MOHCD Affordable Housing Pipeline
  • Portfolio

columns.name: MOHCD Development ID
columns.description: SF MOHCD unique identifier for the development.

columns.name: Development Name
columns.description: The name of the development provided to SF MOHCD by the developer.

columns.name: Project Status
columns.description: The project's overall stage in the development and rehabilitation process.

columns.name: Construction Status
columns.description: The project's current stage in the development process.

columns.name: Development Status
columns.description: The development's current stage in the development, marketing, and lease-up process.

columns.name: Planning Approval Address
columns.description: The address for the development provided by the SF Planning Department upon approval to begin construction (pre-construction address).

columns.name: Marketing Address
columns.description: The address for the development used for marketing purposes (post-construction address).

columns.name: Supervisor District
columns.description: The San Francisco Supervisorial District where the development is located corresponding to jurisdictions of the elected board of supervisors. For more visit https://data.sfgov.org/Geographic-Locations-and-Boundaries/Map-of-Supervisor-Districts-2022-/63dt-nj2t

columns.name: City Analysis/Marketing Neighborhood
columns.description: The San Francisco neighborhood in which the development is located. These 41 neighborhoods were generated by the SF Department of Public Health and MOHCD with support from the Planning Department by grouping Census tracts to construct neighborhoods that can more easily be analyzed with Census data. For more visit https://data.sfgov.org/-/Analysis-Neighborhoods/j2bu-swwd/about_data

columns.name: Planning Neighborhood
columns.description: The San Francisco neighborhoods defined by the San Francisco Planning Department. For more visit https://data.sfgov.org/Geographic-Locations-and-Boundaries/NeighborhoodQuadrants/6dn4-si7z/about_data

columns.name: Lead Agency
columns.description: The City agency overseeing the development.

columns.name: Housing Program
columns.description: The primary SF MOHCD program the development is under. Defined by what type of housing is provided and how the project was developed and made affordable.

columns.name: Development Type
columns.description: The construction type associated with the development.

columns.name: Tenure
columns.description: Whether the development is occupied through rental or ownership.

columns.name: Entitlement Approval Date
columns.description: The date entitlements for the development are approved by the SF Planning Commission or Zoning Administrator. For OCII developments, when the schematic design is approved by the OCII Commission, the development is considered entitled.  Entitlement is the review and approval process to ensure a development is in compliance applicable Planning code or development plans.

columns.name: Estimated/Actual Construction Start Date
columns.description: The date construction began or or is expected to begin. For projects that have not yet begun construction, this is the estimated date, and for projects that have begun construction, this is the actual date.

columns.name: Planning  Case Number
columns.description: The number assigned to the development using the SF Planning Department's project case numbering system corresponding to the project profile (PRJ) number.

columns.name: Planning Case Number Hyperlink
columns.description: The number assigned to the development using the SF Planning Department's project case numbering system corresponding to the project profile (PRJ) number.

columns.name: Planning Entitlements
columns.description: The development unique identification number assigned to the development by the SF Planning Department. Entitlement is the review and approval process to ensure a development is in compliance with SF Planning code.

columns.name: Section 415 Declaration
columns.description: Indicates how a developer plans to fulfill the requirements of the San Francisco Planning Section 415 code, or better known as the Inclusionary Housing Program. When a housing developer proposes a residential project with 10 or more units, they must either 1) reserve a percentage of units in the new building to be rented or sold at a below market rate (On-Site BMR), 2) reserve a percentage of units in another building they build to be rented or sold at a below market rate (Off-Site BMR), 3) pay a fee (In-Lieu Fee), 4) dedicate land that will become affordable housing (Land Dedication), 5) meet exemption status, such as for student housing (Exempt), 6) negotiate an alternative, such as a preservation agreement, or 6) a combination of any of the options. Projects not subject to Section 415 may elect to build inclusionary units to recieve density bonuses or other benefits. For more visit https://codelibrary.amlegal.com/codes/san_francisco/latest/sf_planning/0-0-0-23792

columns.name: Project Units Planned
columns.description: The total number of planned units, including MOHCD affordable units, non-MOHCD affordable units, managers' units, and market-rate units.

columns.name: Latitude and Longitude (Latitude)
columns.description: The development's location on a map, measured as the distance north or south from the equator.

columns.name: Latitude and Longitude (Longitude)
columns.description: The development's location on a map, measured as the distance east or west from the meridian.

columns.name: On-Site Inclusionary Units Built
columns.description: The number of completed affordable inclusionary units.

columns.name: On-Site Inclusionary Units Planned
columns.description: The number of planned affordable inclusionary units.

columns.name: Non-Unit Inclusionary Type
columns.description: The way in which the developer met Section 415 Inclusionary Housing obligations.

columns.name: Affordable Project Created 1
columns.description: A project that resulted from this development dedicating land or building units off-site.

columns.name: Affordable Project Created 2
columns.description: A project that resulted from this development dedicating land or building units off-site.
